DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Donor Death Certificates Adverse Event Associated with Death International Classification of Diseases Tenth Revision Clinical Modification Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The cause of death as noted on the donor's death certificate.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Donor Death Certificate Adverse Event Associated with Death International Classification of Diseases, Tenth Revision, Clinical Modification Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._The cessation of life._A document earned by a person indicating that the person has specific knowledge, skills, or abilities in the view of a certifying body.  Similarly, a document indicating that a product or process is suitable or in working order for a specific purpose._An adverse event resulting in death._An extension of the ICD-10 created by the U.S. National Center for Health Statistics so that the system could be used to capture more morbidity data. This extension included a section of procedure codes._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Property.preferredName: Death Certificate Adverse Event Associated with Death International Classification of Diseases, Tenth Revision, Clinical Modification Code

Similarly, a document indicating that a product or process is suitable or in working order for a specific purpose.:An adverse event resulting in death.:An extension of the ICD-10 created by the U.S. National Center for Health Statistics so that the system could be used to capture more morbidity data. Concepts.definition: A document earned by a person indicating that the person has specific knowledge, skills, or abilities in the view of a certifying body.  Similarly, a document indicating that a product or process is suitable or in working order for a specific purpose.
An adverse event resulting in death.

Concepts.longName: International Classification of Diseases, Tenth Revision, Clinical Modification
Concepts.definition: An extension of the ICD-10 created by the U.S. National Center for Health Statistics so that the system could be used to capture more morbidity data. This extension included a section of procedure codes.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredName: International Classification of Diseases Tenth Revision Clinical Modification Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
